page.title: 19FELLING GATE CLUB,GATESHEAD
page.content: The{N.E.of England}has a reputation for heavy drinking among the men. One short street in the area has four{ {public houses}within a distance of a few hundred metres. They are old buildings and are left over from the days when there was lots of{heavy {industry}in the area and the workmen needed to clear their throats of dust and grime. One of the oldest{working men's {social clubs}in the area faced closure early this year until it was rescued by{Gateshead Football Club}joining it in a partnership. The cost of building new premises a few years ago had left it with debts of Â£20000 which it could not afford to repay. Is this a sign of changing times and habits?
